docs.abstract: After making billions of dollars and joining forces with Big Tobacco, Juul is trying to reinvent itself as a public-health crusader.
docs.snippet: After making billions of dollars and joining forces with Big Tobacco, Juul is trying to reinvent itself as a public-health crusader.
docs.lead_paragraph: Juul Labs, the company behind the insanely popular vaping device, has a message for the nation’s estimated 37.8 million adult smokers:

docs.abstract: Recent commercial real estate transactions in New York.
docs.snippet: Recent commercial real estate transactions in New York.

docs.abstract: A judge in Missouri upheld the verdict, one of the largest personal injury awards on record, in which women said their ovarian cancer was linked to the company’s baby powder.
docs.snippet: A judge in Missouri upheld the verdict, one of the largest personal injury awards on record, in which women said their ovarian cancer was linked to the company’s baby powder.
docs.lead_paragraph: Johnson & Johnson lost its motion on Wednesday to reverse a jury verdict that awarded $4.69 billion to women who blamed their ovarian cancer on asbestos in the company’s baby powder and other talc products.

headline.main: Johnson & Johnson Loses Bid to Overturn a $4.7 Billion Baby Powder Verdict

docs.abstract: The high-profile auto executive, who faces charges of financial wrongdoing, had been held since November.
docs.snippet: The high-profile auto executive, who faces charges of financial wrongdoing, had been held since November.
docs.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — Carlos Ghosn, the former Nissan Motor chairman facing charges of financial wrongdoing in Japan, was released on bail on Wednesday after being held in a Tokyo jail since late November.

headline.main: Carlos Ghosn, Former Nissan Chairman, Is Released on Bail in Japan
headline.print_headline: Former Nissan Chief Is Released on Bail

docs.abstract: A special committee said the company needed to move past the former chief executive, and it lay blame for its failings at his feet.
docs.snippet: A special committee said the company needed to move past the former chief executive, and it lay blame for its failings at his feet.
docs.lead_paragraph: YOKOHAMA, Japan — A committee formed to address failings of Nissan’s corporate governance recommended an overhaul of the Japanese automaker’s board on Wednesday as it seeks to move past the arrest of its former chairman Carlos Ghosn.

headline.main: Nissan Panel Urges Stronger Oversight in Wake of Carlos Ghosn’s Arrest
headline.print_headline: Nissan Panel Suggests A Complete Overhaul

docs.abstract: In a video recorded before his most recent arrest, the former auto chief said executives responsible for the company’s slide had plotted against him.
docs.snippet: In a video recorded before his most recent arrest, the former auto chief said executives responsible for the company’s slide had plotted against him.
docs.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — Carlos Ghosn, the former head of Nissan Motor, slammed the company’s management on Tuesday, arguing that the same executives he says engineered his downfall from the top of a vast auto empire are running the Japanese automaker into the ground.

headline.main: Carlos Ghosn Accuses Nissan Officials of Mismanagement
headline.print_headline: Ghosn Blames Nissan Executives for Downfall

docs.abstract: The utility faces an estimated $30 billion exposure to liability for damages from the 2017 and 2018 wildfires that killed scores in Northern California.
docs.snippet: The utility faces an estimated $30 billion exposure to liability for damages from the 2017 and 2018 wildfires that killed scores in Northern California.
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Pacific Gas and Electric Company announced the departure of its chief executive Sunday as it remained besieged by a financial crisis related to California’s historic wildfires.

headline.main: PG&E Chief Is Out as Utility Faces California Fire Liability
headline.print_headline: PG&E Chief Is Leaving Amid Wildfire Liability

docs.abstract: Automakers are rolling out models meant to widen the appeal of electric cars. But making it easier and faster to charge them is a crucial challenge.
docs.snippet: Automakers are rolling out models meant to widen the appeal of electric cars. But making it easier and faster to charge them is a crucial challenge.
docs.lead_paragraph: ANN ARBOR, Mich. — Just before Thanksgiving, Ken Westerman came close to buying his first fully electric car, a Tesla Model 3.

headline.main: Electric Vehicles Are in the Spotlight at Detroit’s 2019 Auto Show
headline.print_headline: Electric Cars In Spotlight, But Demand In Question

docs.abstract: Ren Zhengfei, C.E.O. of the Chinese tech giant, said he would wait to see if President Trump intervened in the case of his daughter, who is accused of fraud.
docs.snippet: Ren Zhengfei, C.E.O. of the Chinese tech giant, said he would wait to see if President Trump intervened in the case of his daughter, who is accused of fraud.
docs.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — To entrepreneurs in China, he is a legend akin to Steve Jobs.

headline.main: Huawei’s Reclusive Founder Rejects Spying and Praises Trump
headline.print_headline: C.E.O. Insists Huawei Is Not a Spy

docs.abstract: The company said it would increase rates for its 58 million subscribers in the United States 13 to 18 percent, its biggest increase since it started its streaming service 12 years ago.
docs.snippet: The company said it would increase rates for its 58 million subscribers in the United States 13 to 18 percent, its biggest increase since it started its streaming service 12 years ago.

headline.main: Netflix Is Raising Prices. Here’s Why.
headline.print_headline: Why Netflix’s Prices Are Going Up
